skill_description: This skill should be used when users need to build AI-powered user interfaces using the Vercel AI SDK UI. It provides comprehensive guidance on React hooks (useChat, useCompletion, useObject), streaming protocols, chat interfaces, tool calling, message persistence, error handling, and advanced patterns like resumable streams and custom data streaming.

core.description: Core React hooks and basic functionality for AI interfaces

streaming.description: Advanced streaming patterns, protocols, and custom data streaming

tools.description: Tool calling, function execution, and complex interactions

persistence.description: Message storage, persistence, and metadata handling

error_handling.description: Error handling patterns, warning management, and recovery strategies

transport.description: Custom transport configuration and request handling

level1_metadata.description: YAML frontmatter with skill name and description

level2_skill_md.description: Main skill documentation with workflows, patterns, and module routing

level3_references.description: Original documentation files for detailed information

content_strategy.main_focus: Practical implementation patterns with code examples
content_strategy.reference_heavy: Direct users to original documentation for detailed API specs
content_strategy.workflow_oriented: Structure content around common development workflows
content_strategy.type_safety_emphasis: Highlight TypeScript and Zod schema usage throughout

quality_checklist: All key APIs from analysis are covered in routing logic
YAML frontmatter follows kebab-case naming and third-person description
Progressive disclosure maintains reasonable content sizes
Original documents preserved in references/ directory
Routing patterns prioritize common use cases
Module groupings reflect natural developer workflows
